image.altText: Julie Bishop looks serious at a press conference.

props.synopsis: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop provides a formal written response "categorically" denying allegations of bullying, harassment and hostile behaviour, levelled against her during a Senate committee hearing last month.

title.children: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop formally responds to bullying allegations

image.altText: A smartly dressed woman with short hair leaves a court building next to a man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Former Canberra Institute of Technology CEO Leanne Cover loses her bid to challenge a finding that she engaged in "serious corrupt conduct" over the arrangement of contracts to a consultant.

title.children: Former CIT CEO loses bid to challenge finding she engaged in 'serious corrupt conduct'

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A teenage girl is facing five charges, including an allegation she encouraged her ex-partner to take his own life in an angry stream of messages after she ended their relationship.

title.children: Jury urged to consider age of teen accused of assault, harassment of ex

image.altText: A woman walking outside court.

props.synopsis: A Canberra court hears a former business owner who pleaded guilty to sexual offences against three former employees has shown no remorse for her offending, instead portraying her actions as consensual to minimise her responsibility.

title.children: Former Canberra business owner jailed for grooming teen employees

image.altText: A tail of a Qantas plane is seen on the runway at Sydney Airport, Sydney,

props.synopsis: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.

title.children: Qantas may close staff bases in Mildura, Canberra and Hobart

image.altText: Neville Bonner in bronze.

props.synopsis: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian with a bronze sculpture commemorating his life and legacy outside Old Parliament House.

title.children: First Indigenous parliamentarian's iconic boomerang throw immortalised

image.altText: A close up of a woman standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Negotiations between the ACT government and ACT Greens will lead to the return of a lifeline for renters on the financial brink.

title.children: 'Would be living in my car': ACT rent relief scheme to be resurrected

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit holds a framed image of a young woman to his chest outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The father of a 22-year-old woman who died after her motorbike collided with a bus earlier this year has given emotional statement outside court, as the bus driver is spared jail for negligent driving causing death.

title.children: 'No sentence can bring my daughter back': Bus driver spared jail over crash

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

title.children: Trump confirms Albo meeting, Coalition's net-zero debate rolls on

image.altText: Brittany Higgins looks at the right.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins lodges an appeal against a WA Supreme Court judgement that she defamed her former boss and ex-Liberal senator Linda Reynolds in social media posts.

title.children: Brittany Higgins files last-day appeal over Linda Reynolds defamation ruling

image.altText: A beautifully refurbished church which is now a school's performing arts centre

props.synopsis: St Michael's Grammar School in St Kilda says the staff member responsible for an annotated cast list for the Year 6 musical has resigned from their position.

title.children: Educator resigns over inappropriate descriptions of students

image.altText: Victor Radley looks ahead during a Sydney Roosters' NRL match.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

title.children: Roosters hand Radley 'heaviest sanction' in club's history

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel announced his son had open heart surgery

props.synopsis: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

title.children: Hollywood is acutely aware the death of late-night TV is near

image.altText: PROXY - Indigenous flags

props.synopsis: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

title.children: 'New national entity' divides First Nations delegates at National Gathering

image.altText: A floral tribute on the side of the road, with a 60km speed limit sign in the background.

props.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

title.children: Family of Aboriginal hit-and-run victim voice 'disgust' over offender texts

image.altText: A large yellow plane with red letters 'DHL' sits on tarmac

props.synopsis: The suspects are said to have sent packages containing homemade explosive devices to other European countries via courier services, the Lithuania-based prosecutor said in a statement.

title.children: Prosecutors allege Russia-linked network organised arson attacks across Europe

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman sitting at a table with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August, despite more than 5,000 jobs being lost last month.

title.children: Jobs market 'running out of steam' despite steady unemployment rate

image.altText: Queen Camilla, King Charles, Donald and Melanie Trump standing in formal wear and smiling on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Surrounded by high-level politicians, a media mogul, tech giants and athletes, the grandeur-loving US president was treated to a glowing spectacle at Windsor Castle.

title.children: Donald Trump's historic banquet dinner visit in pictures

image.altText: Remah Naj Friday

props.synopsis: Queensland counter-terrorism detectives charge a man with making verbal threats via a carriage service to Remah Naji, a spokesperson for a Brisbane-based pro-Palestinian action group.

title.children: Man charged with threatening to kill pro-Palestinian rally organiser

image.altText: A group of black cows gathered around fresh hay in a dry field.

props.synopsis: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

title.children: Record Aussie cow price as US demand hits 'scary times'

image.altText: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell in A Big Bold Beautiful Journey

props.synopsis: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell tell News Breakfast that 'the best part' of working on their new movie A Big Bold Beautiful Journey was each other.

title.children: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell bond over Aussie 'delicacy'

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: The investment arm of Abu Dhabi's state-owned oil company has dropped its $30 billion takeover bid for Santos.

title.children: Abu Dhabi consortium drops $30b bid to take over Santos

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: Eleven counts of aggravated indecent assault against the veteran broadcaster have been dropped in what the magistrate described as a "reformation" of the case.

title.children: Alan Jones's defence lawyer hails 'very big development' in charges

image.altText: A man uses a squeegee and soapy water to clean a window

props.synopsis: Windows and fly screens are often the first things we see when we walk into a home, but rarely at the top of the spring-cleaning to-do list. Experts share their tips on the easiest and most effective ways to clean them.

title.children: The easiest and most effective ways to clean windows and fly screens

image.altText: the entrance to a kmart store

props.synopsis: The privacy commissioner has found Kmart broke the Privacy Act with its use of facial recognition technology, ordering the retail giant not to repeat the practice.

title.children: Use of facial recognition technology in Kmart stores broke privacy act

image.altText: Proponent releases virtual tour of new Hobart AFL stadium

props.synopsis: The agency behind Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium build says it is undeterred by the three key issues raised by the recent planning commission's final report, arguing it comes down to "priorities".

title.children: Negative findings in Hobart stadium report dismissed as 'matters of opinion and choice'

image.altText: AFL club captains sit around the 2025 premiership cup

props.synopsis: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

title.children: How arrival of mass player movement era 'completely backfired' on the AFL

image.altText: An empty section of a supermarket shelf with a small sign saying "this item is currently unable to be sold".

props.synopsis: Hundreds of cartons of nappy pants remain unaccounted for after one of the biggest threats to Australia's grain industry, khapra beetle larvae, was found in the imported products.

title.children: Authorities call on parents to check nappy pants for invasive pest

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has finally announced the start date of a trial of pets on flights, beginning next month between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine coasts.

title.children: Virgin's pets on planes trial gets mixed reaction

image.altText: a freshly caught pink snapper

props.synopsis: Prized fish species including dhufish, snapper and red emperor are at severe risk of population collapse along WA's coast, prompting the state government to flag even stricter measures to protect stocks.

title.children: Prized WA fish species at 'severe risk' as tougher restrictions mooted

image.altText: A composite of Susan Close and Stephen Mullighan. Susan has brown hair and wears red jacket. Stephen has a suit

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General Kyam Maher will replace Susan Close as deputy premier after the latter and Treasurer Stephen Mullighan announced they will quit politics.

title.children: New SA deputy premier announced after top ministers quit politics ahead of state election

image.altText: PNG Kumuls

props.synopsis: Observers say Papua New Guinea's decades-long history of rugby league success and passion is on its side as it prepares for the next sporting leap into the NRL.

title.children: How PNG is preparing to turn a national obsession into a sporting 'birthright'

image.altText: Aung San Suu Ky looks intensely into the camera at a conference.

props.synopsis: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

title.children: Former human rights leader now stuck in a prison 'hellhole', son claims

image.altText: Chappell Roan stands on top of a big toy horse in a Western costume with her hair out and an arm raised

props.synopsis: The Midwest Princess is finally coming back to see us with her first national tour of Australia.

title.children: Chappell Roan, PinkPantheress and more saddle up for Laneway Festival 2026
